{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Computer / ICT Tutor",
  "description": "TAIDOB College is a government approved private secondary school strategically located within Goshen Estate, Asero, Abeokuta, Ogun State. Dr. Abayomi Oluwatosin Jiboku, a seasoned educationist cum administrator established the college in October 1994 as a model with the motive of providing educational services to all races irrespective of gender, religion, tribe or social status. This unique citadel of learning is situated in a quiet, serene and conducive environment, equipped with modern educational infrastructural facilities and of dedicated and experienced tutors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Computer / ICT Tutor
Job Location:&nbsp;Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Teaching specialized subject(s) to students in designated classes.
	Attending to all assigned classes regularly and punctually.
	Conducting class tests, periodic tests, practical/projects, homework etc on a regular basis and marking all exercise books while proper records obtained by students are kept as continuous assessments.
	Involvement in the conduct of afternoon session classes for students at designated times on the timetable.


Requirements


	Must possess at least B.Sc., B.Ed., HND, in Computer Science or other related fields from reputable institutions.
	Must possess at least 2 years of cognate experience teaching ICT/ Computer in a secondary school.
	Minimum of 2 years experience working as a Computer Tutor
	Meticulous attention to detail with superb organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N105,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;tcrecruitment10@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-09",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Taidob College"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

Computer / ICT Tutor Job at TAIDOB College




        
    

        
        TAIDOB College is a government approved private secondary school strategically located within Goshen Estate, Asero, Abeokuta, Ogun State. Dr. Abayomi Oluwatosin Jiboku, a seasoned educationist cum administrator established the college in October 1994 as a model with the motive of providing educational services to all races irrespective of gender, religion, tribe or social status. This unique citadel of learning is situated in a quiet, serene and conducive environment, equipped with modern educational infrastructural facilities and of dedicated and experienced tutors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Computer / ICT Tutor
Job Location: Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Responsibilities


	Teaching specialized subject(s) to students in designated classes.
	Attending to all assigned classes regularly and punctually.
	Conducting class tests, periodic tests, practical/projects, homework etc on a regular basis and marking all exercise books while proper records obtained by students are kept as continuous assessments.
	Involvement in the conduct of afternoon session classes for students at designated times on the timetable.


Requirements


	Must possess at least B.Sc., B.Ed., HND, in Computer Science or other related fields from reputable institutions.
	Must possess at least 2 years of cognate experience teaching ICT/ Computer in a secondary school.
	Minimum of 2 years experience working as a Computer Tutor
	Meticulous attention to detail with superb organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N105,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tcrecruitment10@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Account Lead",
  "description": "AllFlavors Supreme Foods manufactures premium snacks with high quality ingredients, using top quality machines and advanced techniques to reach and maintain our products&#39; premium quality. We are ISO 9001 and 22000 certified.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilorin, Kwara / Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: FMCG
Reports To: MD

Job&nbsp;Summary


	We are seeking a dedicated and proactive Account Lead to join our dynamic team.
	The Account Leadwill oversee the company&rsquo;s financial reporting, budgeting, and internal control processes.
	This role is critical in supporting strategic decision-making through accurate financial management and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and manage daily accounting operations, including accounts payable, receivable, and general ledger
	Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
	Monitor company budgets and assist in forecasting and financial planning
	Implement and maintain strong internal controls
	Support the finance manager with strategic financial initiatives
	Ensure compliance with statutory and tax regulations
	Liaise with external auditors, tax authorities, and regulatory bodies
	Supervise and mentor junior accounting staff.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum 5 years of progressive experience in finance roles, with at least 2 years in a manufacturing or industrial setting.
	Professional qualification will be considered a plus.
	Working knowledge of all statutory legislation and regulations.
	Strong knowledge of cost accounting principles and financial analysis in a production environment.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., SAP, Odoo, QuickBooks) and MS Excel.


Skills &amp; Attriburtes:


	A solid understanding of financial statistics and accounting principles.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.


Salary
N300,000 - N450,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;fin@allflavors.odoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-10",

  },

Account Lead Job at AllFlavors Supreme Foods




        
    

        
        AllFlavors Supreme Foods manufactures premium snacks with high quality ingredients, using top quality machines and advanced techniques to reach and maintain our products' premium quality. We are ISO 9001 and 22000 certified.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Lead

Job Location: Ilorin, Kwara / Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: FMCG
Reports To: MD

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dedicated and proactive Account Lead to join our dynamic team.
	The Account Leadwill oversee the company’s financial reporting, budgeting, and internal control processes.
	This role is critical in supporting strategic decision-making through accurate financial management and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and manage daily accounting operations, including accounts payable, receivable, and general ledger
	Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
	Monitor company budgets and assist in forecasting and financial planning
	Implement and maintain strong internal controls
	Support the finance manager with strategic financial initiatives
	Ensure compliance with statutory and tax regulations
	Liaise with external auditors, tax authorities, and regulatory bodies
	Supervise and mentor junior accounting staff.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum 5 years of progressive experience in finance roles, with at least 2 years in a manufacturing or industrial setting.
	Professional qualification will be considered a plus.
	Working knowledge of all statutory legislation and regulations.
	Strong knowledge of cost accounting principles and financial analysis in a production environment.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., SAP, Odoo, QuickBooks) and MS Excel.


Skills & Attriburtes:


	A solid understanding of financial statistics and accounting principles.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.


Salary
N300,000 - N450,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: fin@allflavors.odoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Civil Engineer",
  "description": "CNG CareerTouch Services is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The ideal candidate will support the Site Engineer in overseeing construction activities, ensuring compliance with plans, safety standards, and quality control.
	This role requires strong technical skills, attention to detail, and excellent communication abilities.


Key Responsibilities


	Support site supervision, ensuring work follows plans, specs, and safety standards.
	Track progress, measurements, and quantities for billing and verification.
	Ensure compliance with drawings and specifications.
	Coordinate material handling and storage.
	Assist in quality control checks and reporting.
	Conduct site inspections to identify potential issues.
	Prepare and submit reports on project progress and issues.
	Collaborate with other departments to resolve site-related issues.
	Maintain site records and documentation.
	Promote safety compliance and report hazards.
	Coordinate with teams, subcontractors, and senior engineers.
	Ensure adherence to company policies and procedures.
	Support in resolving technical issues and queries.
	Maintain accurate records of site activities, including daily logs and progress reports.
	Participate in site meetings and contribute to discussions on project progress and challenges.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Engineering, or related field.
	Proven experience (1 - 3+ years) as a site engineer or similar role in construction projects.
	Strong knowledge of engineering principles, construction methods, and safety regulations.
	Experience working with engineering software such as AutoCAD, MS Project, or Revit.
	Ability to work in fast-paced environments and make decisions under pressure.
	Basic understanding of budgeting, resource allocation, and quality control.


What We Offer


	Competitive monthly salary and bonus.
	Opportunity to work with a leading construction company.
	Collaborative, dynamic, and supportive work environment.
	Development and training opportunities.
	Recognition and rewards for outstanding performance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;cvhouse2025@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Assistant Site Engineer&#39;&#39; as the subject of the email.",

Civil Engineer Job at CNG CareerTouch Service




        
    

        
        CNG CareerTouch Services is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The ideal candidate will support the Site Engineer in overseeing construction activities, ensuring compliance with plans, safety standards, and quality control.
	This role requires strong technical skills, attention to detail, and excellent communication abilities.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Support site supervision, ensuring work follows plans, specs, and safety standards.
	Track progress, measurements, and quantities for billing and verification.
	Ensure compliance with drawings and specifications.
	Coordinate material handling and storage.
	Assist in quality control checks and reporting.
	Conduct site inspections to identify potential issues.
	Prepare and submit reports on project progress and issues.
	Collaborate with other departments to resolve site-related issues.
	Maintain site records and documentation.
	Promote safety compliance and report hazards.
	Coordinate with teams, subcontractors, and senior engineers.
	Ensure adherence to company policies and procedures.
	Support in resolving technical issues and queries.
	Maintain accurate records of site activities, including daily logs and progress reports.
	Participate in site meetings and contribute to discussions on project progress and challenges.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Engineering, or related field.
	Proven experience (1 - 3+ years) as a site engineer or similar role in construction projects.
	Strong knowledge of engineering principles, construction methods, and safety regulations.
	Experience working with engineering software such as AutoCAD, MS Project, or Revit.
	Ability to work in fast-paced environments and make decisions under pressure.
	Basic understanding of budgeting, resource allocation, and quality control.


What We Offer


	Competitive monthly salary and bonus.
	Opportunity to work with a leading construction company.
	Collaborative, dynamic, and supportive work environment.
	Development and training opportunities.
	Recognition and rewards for outstanding performance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cvhouse2025@gmail.com using "Assistant Site Engineer'' as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Customer Service Supervisor",
  "description": "Beaconhill Smile Clinic is an upscale dental practice located in the commercial and residential area of Victoria Island &amp; Ikeja, Lagos. Weare a team of experienced professionals with several years of training.We provide comprehensive dental care using state-of-the-art technology to deliver comfortable cosmetic and family dental services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Supervisor
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As a Customer Service Supervisor, you&#39;ll oversee daily front desk operations, manage patient relationships, and ensure excellent customer service.
	You&#39;ll lead a team of customer service representatives, providing guidance and support to ensure our clinic&#39;s high standards are met.


Responsibilities


	Supervise and train customer service representatives.
	Manage patient scheduling, billing, and inquiries.
	Ensure excellent customer service and patient satisfaction.
	Resolve patient complaints and concerns.
	Collaborate with dental staff to ensure smooth clinic operations.
	Develop and implement customer service policies and procedures.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	At least 2 years of experience in customer service or front desk operations in the health sector.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
	Knowledge of dental clinic operations is an advantage.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunity to work in a dynamic and growing clinic.
	Collaborative and supportive work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;humanresources@beaconhillsmile.com&nbsp;and:&nbsp;recrutiment@beaconhillsmile.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note:&nbsp;We look forward to hearing from you!",

Customer Service Supervisor Job at Beaconhill Smile Clinic




        
    

        
        Beaconhill Smile Clinic is an upscale dental practice located in the commercial and residential area of Victoria Island & Ikeja, Lagos. Weare a team of experienced professionals with several years of training.We provide comprehensive dental care using state-of-the-art technology to deliver comfortable cosmetic and family dental services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Supervisor
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	As a Customer Service Supervisor, you'll oversee daily front desk operations, manage patient relationships, and ensure excellent customer service.
	You'll lead a team of customer service representatives, providing guidance and support to ensure our clinic's high standards are met.


Responsibilities


	Supervise and train customer service representatives.
	Manage patient scheduling, billing, and inquiries.
	Ensure excellent customer service and patient satisfaction.
	Resolve patient complaints and concerns.
	Collaborate with dental staff to ensure smooth clinic operations.
	Develop and implement customer service policies and procedures.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	At least 2 years of experience in customer service or front desk operations in the health sector.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
	Knowledge of dental clinic operations is an advantage.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunity to work in a dynamic and growing clinic.
	Collaborative and supportive work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume and Cover Letter to: humanresources@beaconhillsmile.com and: recrutiment@beaconhillsmile.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: We look forward to hearing from you!    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Myafrimall Logistics Limited is an independent customs broker/customs intermediary dedicated to providing solutions to all customs&nbsp;clearance needs whether import or export.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer (Onsite)
Job Location:&nbsp;Ogba, Ikeja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are hiring a Graphics Designer with creative and social media skills to join our growing team.


Key Responsibilities


	Design visually appealing graphics for web and print (flyers, banners, social media posts, etc.).
	Create brand-aligned content that communicates logistics services clearly.
	Edit short videos for social media (e.g. reels, ads, promotional clips).
	Collaborate with the marketing team to plan and execute online campaigns.
	Assist with social media page management, posting schedules, and basic engagement.


Requirements


	OND/HND/BSc in any field.
	Proven experience in graphic design and content creation.
	Proficient in Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or similar tools.
	Basic video editing skills (CapCut, InShot, Adobe Premiere, etc.).
	Strong communication skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
Very Competitive

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@myafrimall.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Graphics Designer (Onsite) Job at Myafrimall Logistics Limited




        
    

        
        Myafrimall Logistics Limited is an independent customs broker/customs intermediary dedicated to providing solutions to all customs clearance needs whether import or export.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer (Onsite)
Job Location: Ogba, Ikeja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are hiring a Graphics Designer with creative and social media skills to join our growing team.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Design visually appealing graphics for web and print (flyers, banners, social media posts, etc.).
	Create brand-aligned content that communicates logistics services clearly.
	Edit short videos for social media (e.g. reels, ads, promotional clips).
	Collaborate with the marketing team to plan and execute online campaigns.
	Assist with social media page management, posting schedules, and basic engagement.


Requirements


	OND/HND/BSc in any field.
	Proven experience in graphic design and content creation.
	Proficient in Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or similar tools.
	Basic video editing skills (CapCut, InShot, Adobe Premiere, etc.).
	Strong communication skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
Very Competitive

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@myafrimall.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
